title: Ticket #3159: condor_config.generic should only contain macros
description:
The condor_config.generic file that gets installed, typically in /etc/condor/condor_config, contains many parameters,

$ grep -v -e "^[ ]*#" -e "^$" /etc/condor/condor_config | wc -l -> 313

(not all 313 are params, some are macros, about 300 are unique)

  1. Some params should simply be removed, e.g. HDFS values do not work OOTB.
  2. Params without defaults in the param table should be added to the param table. Then,
  3. The params with defaults in the param table should be removed.

Macros used in other configuration values, e.g. CONDOR_HOST, should remain for this pass. Examples that are not used (maybe some UWCS_*?) should remain but be commented out.

Some benefits include being able to use ~/.condor/condor_config w/ LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE=/etc/condor/condor_config and override basic defaults (see #3158), reducing private memory footprint in daemons (think shadow), and cleaner integration w/ the param table.
